page.title: 13Children's leisure.
page.content: Children may join the Boy Scouts or the Girl Guides or the Jazzband. During school playtimes we play the usual games. The boys play football or cricket. Sometimes the girls may join in but they may be skipping or playing 'two-baller'. Tiggy-on-high is popular and so is British Bulldog but this can become too rough when children are lifted off the ground and is sometimes banned at school. At certain times there may be crazes for particular games such as marbles or conkers or collecting football stickers. We have no amusement arcades with slot machines or 'space invader' machines but the open countryside around us more than makes up for this.
